result.execSummary:
The defendant Rees A. Redday was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rees A. Redday

defendant.name: Redday, Rees A.

records.addlTxt: 09:25 AM Defendant Rees A. Redday by video from Stanley Correctional with attorney Matthew Prior by phone.  Defendant Rees A. Redday in custody.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   ADA Niemi states agreement.  No contest plea entered.  Plea questionnaire previously filed.  Rights given.  Court finds that defendant is knowingly and voluntarily waiving right to jury trial and plea is found to be entered knowingly and voluntarily.  Found guilty.  No further statement from ADA Niemi, Attorney Prior or defendant.  Fined $500.00 with fines and costs included, bond to be applied.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 2, 2019 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 9, 2019 at 09:15 am.

Court Commissioner Steve Garbowicz presiding. Defendant Rees A. Redday appeared by phone means with Attorney Matthew Prior. Prosecuting Atty Scott E. Niemi appeared for State of Wisconsin  Complaint understood.  Waive reading.  Attorney Prior indicates that his client stands mute.  NGP entered by Court.  Bond addressed.  Money was posted due to the warrant issued, but bond that was sent to Clark Co for defenant to sign was never returned.  It is noted that defendant is going to be in prision for about 16 more months so the need for a signed bond is a mute point at this time.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 30, 2019 at 09:45 am.
Not on the record.  Defendant currently being transported from Clark Co jail to Dodge.  Court will adjourn hearing.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 18, 2019 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Rees A. Redday appeared by phone means from Clark Co jail. Prosecuting Atty Scott E. Niemi appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant indicates that he has attempted to contact the public defender's office without success.  Attorney Chad Lynch from the public defender's office indicates that his office doesn't accept collect calls, but will advise office to accept the defendant's call.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 25, 2019 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Rees A. Redday
Current: 517 Court Street  Room 308, c/o Clark County Jail, Neillsville, WI 54456 United States  (Effective: 01-28-2019)
Prior: 231 Gebhardt Road, Black River Falls, WI 54615 United States

Cash bond posted 3/1/17

PUBLIC DEFENDER'S OFFICE:  715-369-1655

Defendant Rees A. Redday appeared by phone means from Clark County Jail. Prosecuting Atty Scott E. Niemi appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states that he has never been provided a copy of the complaint.  Court explains charges to defendant on the record and directs ADA to provide a copy of complaint to Clark Co jail for service on defendant.  Defendant indicates that he is currently in jail on a cash bond for pending charges.  Court will adjourn initial appearance to 2/11/19 at 10 am.  Defendant to appear by phone if still in jail.  Defendant advised to contact public defender's office and provide written authorization for them to appear on his behalf.
